summary.long: Hebrews is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: God, having of old time spoken unto the fathers in the prophets by divers portions and in divers manners,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: hath at the end of these days spoken unto us in his Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, through whom also he made the worlds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who being the effulgence of his glory, and the very image of his substance, and upholding all things by the word of his power, when he had made purification of sins, sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having become by so much better than the angels, as he hath inherited a more excellent name than they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For unto which of the angels said he at any time,
Thou art my Son,
This day have I begotten thee?
and again,
I will be to him a Father,
And he shall be to me a Son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he again bringeth in the firstborn into the world he saith, And let all the angels of God worship him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of the angels he saith,
Who maketh his angels winds,
And his ministers a flame of fire:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And,
Thou, Lord, in the beginning didst lay the foundation of the earth,
And the heavens are the works of thy hands:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall perish; but thou continuest:
And they all shall wax old as doth a garment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And as a mantle shalt thou roll them up,
As a garment, and they shall be changed:
But thou art the same,
And thy years shall not fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But of which of the angels hath he said at any time,
Sit thou on my right hand,
Till I make thine enemies the footstool of thy feet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to do service for the sake of them that shall inherit salvation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things that were heard, lest haply we drift away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the word spoken through angels proved stedfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense of reward;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how shall we escape, if we neglect so great a salvation? which having at the first been spoken through the Lord, was confirmed unto us by them that heard;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God also bearing witness with them, both by signs and wonders, and by manifold powers, and by gifts of the Holy Spirit, according to his own will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For not unto angels did he subject the world to come, whereof we speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But one hath somewhere testified, saying,
What is man, that thou art mindful of him?
Or the son of man, that thou visitest him?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thou didst put all things in subjection under his feet.
For in that he subjected all things unto him, he left nothing that is not subject to him. But now we see not yet all things subjected to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we behold him who hath been made a little lower than the angels, even Jesus, because of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, that by the grace of God he should taste of death for every man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it became him, for whom are all things, and through whom are all things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the author of their salvation perfect through sufferings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For both he that sanctifieth and they that are sanctified are all of one: for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying,
I will declare thy name unto my brethren,
In the midst of the congregation will I sing thy praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again, I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold, I and the children whom God hath given me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since then the children are sharers in flesh and blood, he also himself in like manner partook of the same; that through death he might bring to nought him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and might deliver all them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For verily not to angels doth he give help, but he giveth help to the seed of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore it behooved him in all things to be made like unto his brethren, that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make propitiation for the sins of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succor them that are tempted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, even Jesus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also was Moses in all his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he hath been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, by so much as he that built the house hath more honor than the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every house is builded by some one; but he that built all things is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were afterward to be spoken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Christ as a son, over his house; whose house are we, if we hold fast our boldness and the glorying of our hope firm unto the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore, even as the Holy Spirit saith,
To-day if ye shall hear his voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation,
Like as in the day of the trial in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where your fathers tried me by proving me,
And saw my works forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As I sware in my wrath,
They shall not enter into my rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed, brethren, lest haply there shall be in any one of you an evil heart of unbelief, in falling away from the living God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but exhort one another day by day, so long as it is called To-day; lest any one of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we are become partakers of Christ, if we hold fast the beginning of our confidence firm unto the end:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: For who, when they heard, did provoke? nay, did not all they that came out of Egypt by Moses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with whom was he displeased forty years? was it not with them that sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that were disobedient?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we see that they were not able to enter in because of unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us fear therefore, lest haply, a promise being left of entering into his rest, any one of you should seem to have come short of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed we have had good tidings preached unto us, even as also they: but the word of hearing did not profit them, because it was not united by faith with them that heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For we who have believed do enter into that rest; even as he hath said,
As I sware in my wrath,
They shall not enter into my rest:
although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he hath said somewhere of the seventh day on this wise, And God rested on the seventh day from all his works;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and in this place again,
They shall not enter into my rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing therefore it remaineth that some should enter thereinto, and they to whom the good tidings were before preached failed to enter in because of disobedience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he again defineth a certain day, To-day, saying in David so long a time afterward (even as hath been said before),
To-day if ye shall hear his voice,
Harden not your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if Joshua had given them rest, he would not have spoken afterward of another day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There remaineth therefore a sabbath rest for the people of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that is entered into his rest hath himself also rested from his works, as God did from his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us therefore give diligence to enter into that rest, that no man fall after the same example of disobedience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the word of God is living, and active, and sharper than any two-edged sword, and piercing even to the dividing of soul and spirit, of both joints and marrow, and quick to discern the thoughts and intents of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there is no creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and laid open before the eyes of him with whom we have to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having then a great high priest, who hath passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have not a high priest that cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but one that hath been in all points tempted like as we are, yet without sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us therefore draw near with boldness unto the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy, and may find grace to help us in time of need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every high priest, being taken from among men, is appointed for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who can bear gently with the ignorant and erring, for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by reason thereof is bound, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no man taketh the honor unto himself, but when he is called of God, even as was Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Christ also glorified not himself to be made a high priest, but he that spake unto him,
Thou art my Son,
This day have I begotten thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as he saith also in another place,
Thou art a priest for ever
After the order of Melchizedek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who in the days of his flesh, having offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death, and having been heard for his godly fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: though he was a Son, yet learned obedience by the things which he suffered;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having been made perfect, he became unto all them that obey him the author of eternal salvation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: named of God a high priest after the order of Melchizedek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of whom we have many things to say, and hard of interpretation, seeing ye are become dull of hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when by reason of the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need again that some one teach you the rudiments of the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of solid food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every one that partaketh of milk is without experience of the word of righteousness; for he is a babe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But solid food is for fullgrown men, even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern good and evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore leaving the doctrine of the first principles of Christ, let us press on unto perfection; not laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the teaching of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this will we do, if God permit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as touching those who were once enlightened and tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the age to come,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then fell away, it is impossible to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put him to an open shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the land which hath drunk the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them for whose sake it is also tilled, receiveth blessing from God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if it beareth thorns and thistles, it is rejected and nigh unto a curse; whose end is to be burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for God is not unrighteous to forget your work and the love which ye showed toward his name, in that ye ministered unto the saints, and still do minister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we desire that each one of you may show the same diligence unto the fulness of hope even to the end:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye be not sluggish, but imitators of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when God made promise to Abraham, since he could swear by none greater, he sware by himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus, having patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For men swear by the greater: and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherein God, being minded to show more abundantly unto the heirs of the promise the immutability of his counsel, interposed with an oath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we may have a strong encouragement, who have fled for refuge to lay hold of the hope set before us:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which we have as an anchor of the soul, a hope both sure and stedfast and entering into that which is within the veil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whither as a forerunner Jesus entered for us, having become a high priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of God Most High, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom also Abraham divided a tenth part of all (being first, by interpretation, King of righteousness, and then also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made like unto the Son of God), abideth a priest continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now consider how great this man was, unto whom Abraham, the patriarch, gave a tenth out of the chief spoils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they indeed of the sons of Levi that receive the priest’s office have commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though these have come out of the loins of Abraham:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he whose genealogy is not counted from them hath taken tithes of Abraham, and hath blessed him that hath the promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But without any dispute the less is blessed of the better.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And here men that die receive tithes; but there one, of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, so to say, through Abraham even Levi, who receiveth tithes, hath paid tithes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchizedek met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if there was perfection through the Levitical priesthood (for under it hath the people received the law), what further need was there that another priest should arise after the order of Melchizedek, and not be reckoned after the order of Aaron?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he of whom these things are said belongeth to another tribe, from which no man hath given attendance at the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is evident that our Lord hath sprung out of Judah; as to which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what we say is yet more abundantly evident, if after the likeness of Melchizedek there ariseth another priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who hath been made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: For there is a disannulling of a foregoing commandment because of its weakness and unprofitableness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for the law made nothing perfect), and a bringing in thereupon of a better hope, through which we draw nigh unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And inasmuch as it is not without the taking of an oath
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: by so much also hath Jesus become the surety of a better covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they indeed have been made priests many in number, because that by death they are hindered from continuing:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he, because he abideth for ever, hath his priesthood unchangeable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore also he is able to save to the uttermost them that draw near unto God through him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For such a high priest became us, holy, guileless, undefiled, separated from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who needeth not daily, like those high priests, to offer up sacrifices, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people: for this he did once for all, when he offered up himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law appointeth men high priests, having infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was after the law, appointeth a Son, perfected for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the things which we are saying the chief point is this: We have such a high priest, who sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, not man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices: wherefore it is necessary that this high priest also have somewhat to offer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if he were on earth, he would not be a priest at all, seeing there are those who offer the gifts according to the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who serve that which is a copy and shadow of the heavenly things, even as Moses is warned of God when he is about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he, that thou make all things according to the pattern that was showed thee in the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now hath he obtained a ministry the more excellent, by so much as he is also the mediator of a better covenant, which hath been enacted upon better promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if that first covenant had been faultless, then would no place have been sought for a second.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers
In the day that I took them by the hand to lead them forth out of the land of Egypt;
For they continued not in my covenant,
And I regarded them not, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel
After those days, saith the Lord;
I will put my laws into their mind,
And on their heart also will I write them:
And I will be to them a God,
And they shall be to me a people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they shall not teach every man his fellow-citizen,
And every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord:
For all shall know me,
From the least to the greatest of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will be merciful to their iniquities,
And their sins will I remember no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that he saith, A new covenant, he hath made the first old. But that which is becoming old and waxeth aged is nigh unto vanishing away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service, and its sanctuary, a sanctuary of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there was a tabernacle prepared, the first, wherein were the candlestick, and the table, and the showbread; which is called the Holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holy of holies;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having a golden altar of incense, and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, wherein was a golden pot holding the manna, and Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and above it cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy-seat; of which things we cannot now speak severally.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these things having been thus prepared, the priests go in continually into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the services;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but into the second the high priest alone, once in the year, not without blood, which he offereth for himself, and for the errors of the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Holy Spirit this signifying, that the way into the holy place hath not yet been made manifest, while the first tabernacle is yet standing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is a figure for the time present; according to which are offered both gifts and sacrifices that cannot, as touching the conscience, make the worshipper perfect,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being only (with meats and drinks and divers washings) carnal ordinances, imposed until a time of reformation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Christ having come a high priest of the good things to come, through the greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this creation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor yet through the blood of goats and calves, but through his own blood, entered in once for all into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the blood of goats and bulls, and the ashes of a heifer sprinkling them that have been defiled, sanctify unto the cleanness of the flesh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish unto God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for this cause he is the mediator of a new covenant, that a death having taken place for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first covenant, they that have been called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where a testament is, there must of necessity be the death of him that made it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a testament is of force where there hath been death: for it doth never avail while he that made it liveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore even the first covenant hath not been dedicated without blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when every commandment had been spoken by Moses unto all the people according to the law, he took the blood of the calves and the goats, with water and scarlet wool and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, This is the blood of the covenant which God commanded to you-ward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry he sprinkled in like manner with the blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And according to the law, I may almost say, all things are cleansed with blood, and apart from shedding of blood there is no remission.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was necessary therefore that the copies of the things in the heavens should be cleansed with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ entered not into a holy place made with hands, like in pattern to the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear before the face of God for us:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holy place year by year with blood not his own;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: else must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once at the end of the ages hath he been manifested to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And inasmuch as it is appointed unto men once to die, and after this cometh judgment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so Christ also, having been once offered to bear the sins of many, shall appear a second time, apart from sin, to them that wait for him, unto salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law having a shadow of the good things to come, not the very image of the things, can never with the same sacrifices year by year, which they offer continually, make perfect them that draw nigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Else would they not have ceased to be offered? because the worshippers, having been once cleansed, would have had no more consciousness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance made of sins year by year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: In whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hadst no pleasure:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then said I, Lo, I am come (In the roll of the book it is written of me)
To do thy will, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying above, Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure therein (the which are offered according to the law),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath he said, Lo, I am come to do thy will. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every priest indeed standeth day by day ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, the which can never take away sins:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he, when he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: henceforth expecting till his enemies be made the footstool of his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Holy Spirit also beareth witness to us; for after he hath said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the covenant that I will make with them
After those days, saith the Lord:
I will put my laws on their heart,
And upon their mind also will I write them;
then saith he,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holy place by the blood of Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by the way which he dedicated for us, a new and living way, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having a great priest over the house of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let us draw near with a true heart in fulness of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience: and having our body washed with pure water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let us hold fast the confession of our hope that it waver not; for he is faithful that promised:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and let us consider one another to provoke unto love and good works;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not forsaking our own assembling together, as the custom of some is, but exhorting one another; and so much the more, as ye see the day drawing nigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more a sacrifice for sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and a fierceness of fire which shall devour the adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man that hath set at nought Moses’ law dieth without compassion on the word of two or three witnesses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of how much sorer punishment, think ye, shall he be judged worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant wherewith he was sanctified an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know him that said, Vengeance belongeth unto me, I will recompense. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were enlightened, ye endured a great conflict of sufferings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: partly, being made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, becoming partakers with them that were so used.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye both had compassion on them that were in bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your possessions, knowing that ye have for yourselves a better possession and an abiding one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cast not away therefore your boldness, which hath great recompense of reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye have need of patience, that, having done the will of God, ye may receive the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For yet a very little while,
He that cometh shall come, and shall not tarry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my righteous one shall live by faith:
And if he shrink back, my soul hath no pleasure in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we are not of them that shrink back unto perdition; but of them that have faith unto the saving of the soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now faith is assurance of things hoped for, a conviction of things not seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For therein the elders had witness borne to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith we understand that the worlds have been framed by the word of God, so that what is seen hath not been made out of things which appear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he had witness borne to him that he was righteous, God bearing witness in respect of his gifts: and through it he being dead yet speaketh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and he was not found, because God translated him: for he hath had witness borne to him that before his translation he had been well-pleasing unto God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and without faith it is impossible to be well-pleasing unto him; for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that seek after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Noah, being warned of God concerning things not seen as yet, moved with godly fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; through which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is according to faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Abraham, when he was called, obeyed to go out unto a place which he was to receive for an inheritance; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith he became a sojourner in the land of promise, as in a land not his own, dwelling in tents, with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he looked for the city which hath the foundations, whose builder and maker is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith even Sarah herself received power to conceive seed when she was past age, since she counted him faithful who had promised:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherefore also there sprang of one, and him as good as dead, so many as the stars of heaven in multitude, and as the sand, which is by the sea-shore, innumerable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them and greeted them from afar, and having confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they that say such things make it manifest that they are seeking after a country of their own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if indeed they had been mindful of that country from which they went out, they would have had opportunity to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now they desire a better country, that is, a heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed of them, to be called their God; for he hath prepared for them a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Abraham, being tried, offered up Isaac: yea, he that had gladly received the promises was offering up his only begotten son;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even he to whom it was said, In Isaac shall thy seed be called:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: accounting that God is able to raise up, even from the dead; from whence he did also in a figure receive him back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau, even concerning things to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph; and worshipped, leaning upon the top of his staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Joseph, when his end was nigh, made mention of the departure of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months by his parents, because they saw he was a goodly child; and they were not afraid of the king’s commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Moses, when he was grown up, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: choosing rather to share ill treatment with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: accounting the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures of Egypt: for he looked unto the recompense of reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of the blood, that the destroyer of the firstborn should not touch them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land: which the Egyptians assaying to do were swallowed up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they had been compassed about for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Rahab the harlot perished not with them that were disobedient, having received the spies with peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what shall I more say? for the time will fail me if I tell of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah; of David and Samuel and the prophets:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness were made strong, waxed mighty in war, turned to flight armies of aliens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Women received their dead by a resurrection: and others were tortured, not accepting their deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and others had trial of mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were stoned, they were sawn asunder, they were tempted, they were slain with the sword: they went about in sheepskins, in goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, ill-treated
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (of whom the world was not worthy), wandering in deserts and mountains and caves, and the holes of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these all, having had witness borne to them through their faith, received not the promise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God having provided some better thing concerning us, that apart from us they should not be made perfect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let us also, seeing we are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: looking unto Jesus the author and perfecter of our faith, who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising shame, and hath sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For consider him that hath endured such gainsaying of sinners against himself, that ye wax not weary, fainting in your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth,
And scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is for chastening that ye endure; God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is there whom his father chasteneth not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye are without chastening, whereof all have been made partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, we had the fathers of our flesh to chasten us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they indeed for a few days chastened us as seemed good to them; but he for our profit, that we may be partakers of his holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All chastening seemeth for the present to be not joyous but grievous; yet afterward it yieldeth peaceable fruit unto them that have been exercised thereby, even the fruit of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore lift up the hands that hang down, and the palsied knees;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make straight paths for your feet, that that which is lame be not turned out of the way, but rather be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow after peace with all men, and the sanctification without which no man shall see the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: looking carefully lest there be any man that falleth short of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby the many be defiled;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest there be any fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one mess of meat sold his own birthright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye know that even when he afterward desired to inherit the blessing, he was rejected; for he found no place for a change of mind in his father, though he sought it diligently with tears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye are not come unto a mount that might be touched, and that burned with fire, and unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; which voice they that heard entreated that no word more should be spoken unto them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they could not endure that which was enjoined, If even a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so fearful was the appearance, that Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but ye are come unto mount Zion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to innumerable hosts of angels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the general assembly and church of the firstborn who are enrolled in heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to Jesus the mediator of a new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaketh better than that of Abel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not when they refused him that warned them on earth, much more shall not we escape who turn away from him that warneth from heaven:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose voice then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying, Yet once more will I make to tremble not the earth only, but also the heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this word, Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that have been made, that those things which are not shaken may remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us have grace, whereby we may offer service well-pleasing to God with reverence and awe:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for our God is a consuming fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let love of the brethren continue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forget not to show love unto strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; them that are ill-treated, as being yourselves also in the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let marriage be had in honor among all, and let the bed be undefiled: for fornicators and adulterers God will judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye free from the love of money; content with such things as ye have: for himself hath said, I will in no wise fail thee, neither will I in any wise forsake thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that with good courage we say,
The Lord is my helper; I will not fear:
What shall man do unto me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember them that had the rule over you, men that spake unto you the word of God; and considering the issue of their life, imitate their faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and to-day, yea and for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not carried away by divers and strange teachings: for it is good that the heart be established by grace; not by meats, wherein they that occupied themselves were not profited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat that serve the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the bodies of those beasts whose blood is brought into the holy place by the high priest as an offering for sin, are burned without the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people through his own blood, suffered without the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us therefore go forth unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have not here an abiding city, but we seek after the city which is to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through him then let us offer up a sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of lips which make confession to his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit to them: for they watch in behalf of your souls, as they that shall give account; that they may do this with joy, and not with grief: for this were unprofitable for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray for us: for we are persuaded that we have a good conscience, desiring to live honorably in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I exhort you the more exceedingly to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the God of peace, who brought again from the dead the great shepherd of the sheep with the blood of an eternal covenant, even our Lord Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: make you perfect in every good thing to do his will, working in us that which is well-pleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be the glory for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I exhort you, brethren, bear with the word of exhortation: for I have written unto you in few words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know ye that our brother Timothy hath been set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salute all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints. They of Italy salute you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be with you all. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
